meanings.definition: The act of jumping into water with arms and legs tucked in, resembling a cannonball.
meanings.sent1: During the pool party, Sarah's perfect cannonballing made the biggest splash.
meanings.sent2: Kids at the pool love cannonballing into the water on hot summer days.
meanings.sent3: The synchronized swimming team decided to add a cannonballing routine for some fun.
meanings.sent4: His excitement was like a cannonballing into a pool of joy.
meanings.sent5: The memory of cannonballing into the lake will always bring a smile to my face.

meanings.definition: To perform a cannonball dive into water.
meanings.sent1: Tom cannonballing off the diving board was a sight to see.
meanings.sent2: We spent the afternoon cannonballing into the ocean waves.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried cannonballing into the icy water but ended up belly flopping.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter cannonballed through the room, infectious and joyful.
meanings.sent5: The decision to quit his job and travel the world was like cannonballing into the unknown.

meanings.definition: A type of dive where the person jumps into water with their body curled up.
meanings.sent1: The pool competition included a round for the best cannonballing technique.
meanings.sent2: He showed off his cannonballing skills by leaping off the high dive.
meanings.sent3: The cat's unexpected cannonballing into the bathtub caused a splashy mess.
meanings.sent4: Her arrival at the party was like a cannonballing of energy and excitement.
meanings.sent5: The memory of his graceful cannonballing off the cliff will forever be etched in my mind.
